measured_by: Moral reasoning task – 14 hypothetical dilemmas adapted from Koenigs et al., 2007
justification: “Participants completed a moral reasoning task, adapted from Koenigs et al. (2007)… The percentage of Utilitarian decisions was calculated for each moral dilemma type… for use in analysis.”

measured_by: Feeling rating scale (1 = Extremely Bad to 5 = Extremely Good) following each dilemma
justification: “Participants were required to rate ‘How do you feel about your decision?’ (on a scale of ‘Extremely Bad’ (1) to ‘Extremely Good’ (5)). The average … feeling ratings were calculated for each of the moral dilemma types.”
construct: Subjective emotional response to moral decisions

justification: “To explore the effect of social conceptual knowledge on moral decision making, the Social Norms Questionnaire (SNQ; Possin et al., 2013) was administered. The SNQ measures the ability to identify socially appropriate and inappropriate behaviours.”
construct: Social conceptual knowledge / knowledge of social norms

measured_by: Cambridge Behavioural Inventory (CBI) – Total Frequency Score
justification: “Behavioural change was assessed using the Cambridge Behavioural Inventory (CBI Total Frequency Score; Wedderburn et al., 2008).”

measured_by: Clinical Dementia Rating Scale – Frontotemporal Lobar Degeneration (CDR-FTLD) Sum of Boxes
justification: “…the Clinical Dementia Rating Scale-Frontotemporal Lobar Degeneration (CDR-FTLD Sum of Boxes; Knopman et al., 2008) was employed as an index of disease severity.”
“Control participants scored in the cognitively normal range… on a general cognitive screening measure, the Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination-III (ACE-III).”
“bvFTD patients showed impairments in… verbal attention (Digit Span Forward)… compared with Controls.”

measured_by: Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test (RAVLT) – Delayed Recall

justification: “…nonverbal (Rey Complex Figure [RCF] 3 minute recall) episodic memory.”
“…executive function (Trail Making Test Part B-A; Tombaugh, 2004).”
